fields.name: AccessTier
fields.description: Access tier for specific share. GpV2 account can choose between TransactionOptimized (default), Hot, and Cool. FileStorage account can choose Premium.

fields.name: AccessTierChangeTime
fields.description: Indicates the last modification time for share access tier.

fields.name: AccessTierStatus
fields.description: Indicates if there is a pending transition for access tier.

fields.name: Deleted
fields.description: Indicates whether the share was deleted.

fields.name: DeletedTime
fields.description: The deleted time if the share was deleted.

fields.name: EnabledProtocols
fields.description: The authentication protocol that is used for the file share. Can only be specified when creating a share.

fields.name: LastModifiedTime
fields.description: Returns the date and time the share was last modified.

fields.name: LeaseDuration
fields.description: Specifies whether the lease on a share is of infinite or fixed duration, only when the share is leased.

fields.name: LeaseStatus
fields.description: The lease status of the share.

fields.name: Metadata
fields.description: A name-value pair to associate with the share as metadata.

fields.name: RemainingRetentionDays
fields.description: Remaining retention days for share that was soft deleted.

fields.name: RootSquash
fields.description: The property is for NFS share only. The default is NoRootSquash.

fields.name: ShareQuota
fields.description: The maximum size of the share, in gigabytes. Must be greater than 0, and less than or equal to 5TB (5120). For Large File Shares, the maximum size is 102400.

fields.name: ShareUsageBytes
fields.description: The approximate size of the data stored on the share. Note that this value may not include all recently created or recently resized files.

fields.name: SignedIdentifiers
fields.description: List of stored access policies specified on the share.

fields.name: SnapshotTime
fields.description: Creation time of share snapshot returned in the response of list shares with expand param "snapshots".
